page.title: 12Community College:Chatteris
page.content: The aim of the college is to provide both formal and social education. Formal education takes place at the 40 evening classes. The college hopes to attract between 500-600 people after September. The fees work out on average at 70 pence per hour for an adult student. The courses must be self-financing and 25% of money raised goes to Cambridgeshire County Council. The college also runs several groups which help to develop secretarial and managerial skills. One example is the Mothers and Toddlers group. The Pre- School Play Group has a large committee which all members are encouraged to join and contribute to. In the summer holidays there is a playscheme with 250 members for young children aged 3-12. There is a day centre for the elderly which meets twice weekly. There are 100 members.
